g-0: ^The guild chose you to replace him because ...

s: ^... you were the only one available.

g-1: ^Before leaving you once more took an oath to ...

s: ^... serve everyone to the best of your ability.
^... serve the one and true magic.

Introduction: ^The road was long but you can finally see a small hamlet up ahead.

c-0: ^You take a minute to sit on a moldy tree stump before going on.
g-0: ^After just a few more minutes of walk your arrive at the village where Hototo the elder is waiting for you

c-2: ^You shake his old parched hand and he smiles back.

g-1: ^The elders seems very pleased you're finally here.
^After a few cordial pleasanteries, the elder shows you to your hut and leaves you to your business.

s0: ^The hut is small but very tidy.
s1: ^ The walls feel very bland but with a few tweaks here and there you'll soon feel at home.

c-5: ^You drop you heavy pack on the floor. It's been a long way.
^You start arranging your belonging on the various shelves. Colored ropes, wood scents, shiny pearls, weaving runes. Everything needed for your craft in its dedicated place.

g-2: ^You slide under you heavy blankets and sleep instantly. Tommorow will be a big day.

Intro: ^You wake up to the sound of distant ducks quacking happily.
^After a few minutes, you hear a knock on the door.
Night_01: ^As the sun sets you start to wonder what happened to the old Weaver.

c-0: ^ after a fulfilled life helping others.
c-3: ^You're here to weave and that's what you'll do.
tragic_death: ^A shiver runs down your spine. You don't like to think about these kind of things before going to bed.

Night_02: ^The sky is really pretty tonigh. As the clouds burn a bright orange, you take a moment to think about this new rune Kaya found. You're puzzled because ...

s: ^... you didn't knew there was more than two weaving runes.
^... the rune looks like ancient forbidden magic.
^... how could a rune end up inside a deer.

g-0: ^But it's getting late, you'll have more time tommorow to investigate the power of this rune.

Night_03: ^Tonight is as good a night as ever to wonder ...

s: ^... why nobody ever mentions the old weaver.
^... why there is a resident weaver in such a small hamlet.

g-0: ^On your porch, you can see a little girl.

c-1: ^You wave her in and she enters eagerly. You can see she seem very curious.

s: ^Dogs are the worst ! They killed Frederik ... my parrot.

g-3: ^Far away you hear a loud voicing calling "Aponiiii"
^I must go, see you next time !
^She smiles at you before running outside.

Kaya_01: ^Later in the day, you hear a lood knock.

g-0: ^You must be the new Weaver. I need your help with something.

c-1: ^Yes, hello. Like I said I need your help fast.

g-1: ^The wood I have is all wet but I need to light a fire right now. Can't let that deer go to waste.

s: ^Why do you need the fire for ?
^Give me a minute, I'll see what I can do.

c-3: ^To smoke it. Why else would I need a fire for a deer ? Now can I have it ? Please ?

g-2: ^and leaves your hut without looking back.

Petrel_01: ^Early in the morning, just as the rooster sings, you find a sturdy man waiting on your doorstep.

g-0: ^I'm sorry to disturb you in such a peaceful morning but I had no other choice.
g-2: ^My name is Petrel, I'm but a simple farmer here. I keep on praying the spirits but it hasn't rained in days. I'm afraid my crop won't survive another one without water.

s: ^Beg and pray all you want, it's not how rain works.

c-0: ^You can almost smell his relief as you hand him the dream catcher.

b: ^ Yes Reverred Weaver. You are right.

g-3: ^As he leaves your hut, you wonder what kind of crop they grow in the region.

Kaya_02: ^A few moments later, the door opens sundenly.
^I found a strange rune inside it.
^Though it may be of some use to you.

b: ^She nods a little bit longer than last time.

g-0: ^Before you can add anything else, she leaves.

Hototo_01: ^Before you see him, you hear the dragging step of the elder.

g-0: ^That's very kind of you my child.

c-2: ^ I suppose I must get used to the behaviour of some locals.
^Ah ... right ... yes. Well, they are honest, hardworking people, all of them. You'll come to understand, maybe even like them in the end.
c-3: ^The old man seems taken a back. You can see a hint of fright in the corner of his eyes. But he quickly recomposes himself.

g-1: ^I ... didn't want to bother you with an old man nightmares ... but since I'm here.
^Since a few weeks now I dream of a dark shadow strangling me.
^I wake up in sweat and can hardly breathe.
^Would you be able to help me ?
g-2: ^Thank you very much my child. This seems very promising.
^He leaves your hut with the sound of his cane following his footsteps.

Petrel_02: ^Just before the last rays of the sun disappear below the horizon, you see Petrel approaching.

g-1: ^I saw a sign of the holy pattern today !

s: ^I don't care much for your crop circles

c-3: ^. Just like the ones you use to weave.
c-4: ^Thanks to your help, the crop grew almost overnight. Except in some places where the ground remained barren.
^I had to climb to the top of the barn to get a better view.
^That's when I saw it was in fact a divine sign
c-5: ^Yes, the one thing behind everything. Guiding my hand when I plow my field. Guiding yours as you weave. I'm honored the Holy Pattern chose me to deliver its divine message.
c-6: ^, Petrel. Maybe some aliens wanted to mess with you and so what.
^A terror take hold of his face when you mention aliens.
^But aliens are a corruption of the Holy Pattern, surely you must be joking.

g-2: ^He give you a paper with a small drawing on it, bows to the ground, then leaves.

Hototo_02: ^You can hear the slowest footstep of the village approaching.

g-0: ^Thank you for your help child. I can now breathe easily again.
^But I still have nightmares ... or should I call them visions ?
^They are now coming to me in the middle of the day.
^Please child, i'm once again asking for your help. You must have something to clear and soothe the mind of an old man.
^sorry, I'll see what I can do.

c-1: ^ very sorry to hear that. Give me a minute I'll craft you a remedy.

c-0: ^Thank you very much my dear child. I can already feel some of my anxiety receding.
^But I still have a bad feeling.

g-1: ^Dark and forgotten powers are at stakes, I can feel it !
^In my last vision I saw some kind of rune. Here, I've drawn it for you.
g-2: ^You're so fixated on the drawing that you don't even notice the old man leaving.

end: ^... but you keep on studying the rune.

g-2: ^This new sign will let you acces a whole new level of weaving.
^You wonder if that was what the old man was warning you about.

Kaya_03: ^The dawn breaks with a familiar face on your doorstep.
^She put a finger to her mouth and point behind her.

s: ^I didn't hear you say hello, that's for sure.

c-2: ^She stares at you for a hard long minute.
g-0: ^At this hour, the wood should be teeming with life but I can barely hear a thing.

s: ^Doesn't look like it's my problem, does it ?

g-1: ^How can I hunt if there's nothing to hunt.
^Each day I must go further into the wood, only to find meagre game.

s: ^Okay, let me see what I can do.

c-0: ^She pauses a minute to give you the faintest smile.

c-6: ^Maybe because all this meat you've eaten since you're here won't get in your plate by itself ?

s: ^You still have new faces to discover though.
^Just like the one in front of you.

g-0: ^We haven't had the pleasure to meet yet.
g-1: ^I hope you're all settled. When I have the time I also do a few metal sculptures.
^I'd be happy to gift you one if you'd like to decorate those bland walls in your hut.

c-3: ^Alright, I'll bring you one next time I'm around.

g-2: ^She looks like she wants to add something but seem uncertain.

s: ^Please, what can I help you with Hyij ?

c-5: ^That's very nice of you to ask.

g-3: ^It's quite weird but I feel more and more tired these days.
^Sometimes I hardly have the strengh to lift my hammer anymore.

c-7: ^ Give me a minute and you'll feel strong as a bear.

c-0: ^Thank you very much, this should be a huge help !

g-4: ^She wave you goodbye as she leaves the hut.

Night_04: ^The night fell sooner than you'd expected.

s: ^... time flies when you work hard.
^... the end of the world is near.

Aponi_03: ^Noon is around the corner and you hear someone running jauntily toward the hut.

g-0: ^It looks just like your magic cards !

s: ^Because it is a magic card Aponi.

c-5: ^ You should give it to me.
^But it just look like a dumb rock.
^She looks at the rune a moment.

g-2: ^I found it the ashes of the forge anyway.

s: ^And why were you playing with the ashes

g-3: ^I've even tried to howl like he likes.

s: ^Oh poor thing ... don't worry I will help you

c-11: ^, why do you care about it ?

c-12: ^She runs outside and starts howling in every direction.

Hototo_03: ^You're still hearing a few howls in the distance when a weak knock sound against your door.

s: ^Do you have more runes for me ?

c-1: ^I mean, the visions disappeared, thank you ! But
c-3: ^No, that's not why I'm here today.

g-1: ^I can't escape this feeling that the end is near.

s: ^Don't worry, it's just a bad day.

g-2: ^I can feel it in my bones.
^It's funny you know. At my age, I should be waiting eagerly for the long night.
^There's always a path for those able to see.

s: ^I may be able to ease your way.

g-4: ^He smiles with melancoly, bows a little and then leaves.

end: ^It's already dark when you see Aponi, happy like never before.
^At her side and happily panting, you see Cilantro.
^She hugs you for a long moment.

g-0: ^Look what we found in the forest !
^She gives you yet another rune before running off with her trusty friend.
^She's already almost disappeared when you hear screaming back : "goodnight !"
g-1: ^Once alone you start to ponder the meaning of all of this.
^Why do they seem to call eachother ?

s: ^... you'll get to the bottom of this.
^... it's not the end of the world.

c-5: ^As you go to bed, you can hear an owl sing, lonely in the dark night.

g-0: ^Your hut is really dark, except the tinyest sliver of light.
g-1: ^She'll die if we don't do something fast !

c-2: ^That she was lost in the forest isn't a reason to shoot on a cow !
c-3: ^She's a proud servant of the Holy Pattern !
c-4: ^She misstook it for some vulgar game in the forest !

g-2: ^With that my cow must be saved !
^As soon as you give him the dream catcher, he runs in the direction of the forest.

Aponi_04: ^You're about to close the door but you notice a small drawing on the floor just outside.

g-0: ^In the bottom right corner you spot ...
drawing_2: ^Between the two of them floats a little heart.
^In the middle of the drawing you clearly see ...

Hyij_03: ^Later in the day, you hear Hyij knocking on your door.

g-0: ^What you did for Fennel truly is impressive.
g-1: ^However since this incident it's getting tense between Petrel and Kaya.
^I'm affraid the little harmony we have here will shatter if we let the conflict fester.
^You wouldn't have something to help, would you ?

s: ^If I can control Life, surely I can invoke Harmony !

g-3: ^Some days, I wonder what we would do without you.

c-7: ^And for that we are deeply grateful.

g-4: ^Like I promised, here's a small trinket I made for you.

s: ^Thank you ! The perfect complement to my bland walls !

g-5: ^What can I say, all those dream catchers you craft inspired me.
^Anyway, I'll leave you to your things now.
^She waves goodbye and closes the door softly behind her.

s: ^... the trust the hamlet puts in you.
^... the amount of power you have garnered.
^Why does the air feels so thick in here ?
^What is that sinister pounding inside your head ?

g-1: ^Dizzy with worries and a dark hunch, you finally drift to sleep.

s: ^... feeling the sun on your face.

g-1: ^In the beggining of the afternoon, you see Hototo slowly approaching with Hyij.
g-3: ^I've had and long and happy life.
g-4: ^I have absolute faith in Hyij, she'll be a fine elder.
g-5: ^I'm glad I had the chance to meet you.
^And I wanted to thank you one more time for all your help. Especially these last few days.
g-6: ^He looks at your for a long time.
g-7: ^Now, you know what must be done.
g-9: ^You finish to weave the dream catcher and give it to him.
^For the lasty time, you watch him leave in the direction of his home, Hyij by his side.

s: ^Has anyone ever tried summoning every spirit at once ?

g-0: ^Probably not, the more you think about it ...
thinking_2: ^You do not even know what rune could allow that.
^You try to change your mind and focus on ...

s: ^... lending a hand to Petrel in the fields.

g-2: ^One night you wake up in sweat and all you can think about is ...

s: ^... has anybody tried to summon every spirit at once ?
^... has anybody tried to summon every spirit at once ?
^... has anybody tried to summon every spirit at once ?

g-3: ^The outline of a rune you've never seen before burns through your mind.
g-4: ^I must try to sumoon every spirit at once !

s: ^A deep, dark, growl comes from all around you.
^The ground shakes like you've never felt it shake.
^... a hole in the fabric of reality.

s6: ^ I still need one last sacrifice, servant !

g-2: ^As you utter these words, you start to feel ...

s: ^You see your runes flying around in all directions.
^They break through the walls of your small hut and fly away.
^As darkness eats you, one final though crosses your mind.
^You hope your sacrifice will quench the Pattern.
^You didn't think the world would end this way.
^You did summon every spirit at once !
